oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Martha White - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is an excerpt of a Martha White sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from featuring George D. Hay (announcer), Louis Buck (announcer), Anita Carter (performer), Carl Smith (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Cowboy Copas (performer), Anita Carter (performer), the Crook Brothers (performer), Lonzo and Oscar (performer), and Chet Atkins (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording is an excerpt of a Royal Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment featuring Marty Robbins (performer), Grandpa Jones (performer), Roy Acuff (performer), and Jud Collins (announcer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Anita Carter; Carl Smith; Little Jimmy Dickens; Cowboy Copas; Chet Atkins; Grandpa Jones; Marty Robbins; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay whistle and introduction -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Opening theme (Anita Carter) -- Louis Buck introduces Carl Smith -- That's My Trademark (Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Little Jimmy Dickens, Cowboy Copas, Anita Carter, The Crook Brothers, Lonzo and Oscar, and Chet Atkins -- Little Jimmy Dickens talks (incomplete) -- Sing Me Something Sentimental (Marty Robbins) -- Jud Collins and Roy Acuff talks and introduces Grandpa Jones -- Grandpa Jones talks -- Mountain Dew (Grandpa Jones) -- Royal Cola commercial (Jud Collins, Roy Acuff) -- [Unidentified] introduces Roy Acuff -- Mother's Not Dead, She's Only Sleeping (Roy Acuff) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Copas, Cowboy; Carter, Anita, 1933-1999; Crook Brothers; Lonzo and Oscar; Atkins, Chet; Atkins, Chet, 1924-2001; Robbins, Marty; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Collins, Jud; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992;
